name: Boethius
what_did:
Boethius wrote 'The Consolation of Philosophy' while in prison.
The book is a conversation between him and a woman named Philosophy.
He mixed Roman and Greek ideas to help people find peace during hard times.
why_matters:
Boethius helped keep ancient wisdom alive during a time of chaos.
His book was read by many people in the Middle Ages.
He showed that even in prison, people can find deep meaning.

questions.q: Where was Boethius when he wrote his famous book?

fun_fact: His book was one of the most copied texts in medieval Europe!
